repository.orgName: Staats- und UniversitätsBibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary: The text discusses about the rituals performed or followed to celebrate the birth day of Rāma or Kṛṣṇa or other incarnations of lord Viṣṇu. The next day is called pāraṇa, which is also part of the Jayanti celebration. This particular text is written by Gopāladeśika but the same titled text is written by Ānandatīrtha, and Rāmānujācārya .

msItem.title: Jayantīnirṇaya
msItem.author: Gopāladeśika

filiation.p: New Catalogus Catalogorum vol. 06 p. 143 under the entry gopaladeshika and New Catalogus Catalogorum vol.7 p. 182 under the entry Jayantīnirṇaya. Aufrecht Catalogus Jayantīnirṇaya vol. 1 p.200 (https://sanskritlibrary.org/integratedDictionaries.html)

msItem.rubric: śrimate hayagrīvāya namaḥ - śrimate nigamāntegurave namaḥ |
msItem.incipit: vande pumāṁsaṁ paramajayantyā virbhavantaṁ urasīdharantaṁ gopālamasmaddeśikaṁ
msItem.explicit: rāmānujamahādeśikāya namaḥ adya sthitvā nirāhāra hūrte madhusudana bhokṣyāmi puṇḍarikākṣasyajanmāṣṭami vrata iti saṁkalpya

support.p: Palm leaves are used as guard folio. First guard folio is preserved by stitching. The supported palm leaf is stitched with twine. The last cover folio was broken at the middle and is also preserved by stiching with twine.

extent.measure: 2 guard folios, 44 numbered folios, 2 blank folios

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numerals in the left margin.

handNote.desc: Clusters are difficult to identify. Sloppy writing.

additions.desc: hariḥ oṁ is written in the left margin.
Old Shelf marks in blue pencil 15 and 54 on the front cover.
At the beginning and end folio some matter in Granth script is found, which is not part of the main text. It is difficult to read. śriśailaśaṁnāya d śrī maho …

binding.p: Palm leaf is used as cover.

TEI.text:
śrimate hayagrīvāya namaḥ - śrimate nigamāntegurave namaḥ - vande pumāṁsaṁ paramajayantyā virbhavantaṁ urasīdharantaṁ gopālamasmaddeśikaṁ
asmākāṁ śrutiniṣṭhānāṁ sā(… deleted) parigṛhatyā na lokānugrahādhikye na ca paredyuḥ pāraṇā śāstrasyaivādadat avyaktvāccait sarvasamajasaṁ (2) pramo nā dhī kṛṣṇapakṣe ravediṁ na navamyāṁ tra ṣo nārāyāṁ likhate janmāṣṭamī (3) jayantyā śudhyānirṇayassade paraḥ śrīśailavaṁśajātena rāghaveṇa sudhimude śrīmatgopāladeśikāya namaḥ śrīmadvedānta (4) rāmānujamahādeśikāya namaḥ adya sthitvā nirāhāra hūrte madhusudana bhokṣyāmi puṇḍarikākṣasyajanmāṣṭami vrata iti saṁkalpya
